#summary Methods Footprint to query the API
== Introduction ==
This section describes the available methods of the `SocialContext` object.

== Methods ==
_def get_or_create_social_context(request, platform_id=None)_

This static method tries to get a Social Context from the user session. If none is found, it creates a new one with the platform_id.

The platform_id is optional and should be omitted only when there is no doubt that a `Social Context` instance is in the user session. Otherwise, an `Exception` is raised.


_def get_platforms(request, task)_

This static method returns the list of platforms that support a specific task. The tasks supported by a platform are set in the Django admin. They can be 'people', 'groups', 'activities_push', 'activities_pull', 'notifications'.
